content.question:
Neither the x axis nor the y axis show tick marks or a scale. Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window in the bottom of the third quadrant and increases sharply, crossing the x axis and leveling off to a high point in the second quadrant. 

The curve then gradually decreases then levels off to reach a low point on the y axis above the origin.

The curve then gradually increases then levels off to reach a high point in the first quadrant, but lower than the previous high point.

The curve decreases gradually to cross the x axis and levels off to reach a low point in the fourth quadrant. 

The curve increases gradually becoming steeper, crosses the x axis, and exits the window at the top of the first quadrant.

​The graph of the polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is shown. How many points of inflection does the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> have on the given portion of the graph?

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
